about.title: About This Tool
about.description: Pyro Timer is a comprehensive fan-made tool for Star Citizen's contested zone operations in the Pyro system. Track executive hangar cycles, keycard printer cooldowns, and compboard collection all in one place.

featuresList.precision: High-precision executive hangar timer (±1 second accuracy)
featuresList.czTimers: All contested zone objective timers (Checkmate, Orbituary, Ruin Station)
featuresList.compboards: Compboard collection tracker with progress visualization
featuresList.localStorage: Local storage - your data never leaves your device

about.howItWorksText: All timers run in your browser using React and JavaScript. The executive hangar timer calculates the current cycle phase based on the known 185-minute cycle. Contested zone timers and your checklist are saved in your browser's local storage, so they persist even if you close the page.

why.title: Why Do This?
why.paragraph1: Executive Hangar access requires collecting 7 compboards spread across three Contested Zone stations. It's the endgame PvP loop in Pyro.
why.paragraph2: Inside you'll find unique loot, high-value rewards, and some of the most intense PvP encounters in the game. The Executive Hangars themselves operate on a global timer — once you have the compboards, you still need to time your entry.

whatAreCZ.title: What Are Contested Zones?
whatAreCZ.description: Contested Zones are free-fire PvPvE areas — there is no safe mode inside. Three stations host them: Checkmate, Orbituary, and Ruin Station (Ghost Arena).
whatAreCZ.warning: If you enter a Contested Zone, assume PvP. You will encounter other players, and many of them are hostile.
whatAreCZ.pveNote: Note: PvE-focused mission hubs like Levski and QV Service Stations exist in Pyro, but travel between locations is still risky — Pyro is lawless space.

quickstart.title: Quickstart Checklist
quickstart.soloNote: Solo by default — these steps work alone or in a group.
quickstart.step1: Gear up: Loadout, meds, ammo. Don't bring your best — bring what you can afford to lose.
quickstart.step2: Set local respawn at a nearby station before entering.
quickstart.step3: Pick a zone and get inside. Checkmate is the most approachable for beginners.
quickstart.step4: Use printers & collect boards. Start timers on this site when you activate a printer.
quickstart.step5: Extract. Treat leaving as the most dangerous part — don't linger at exits.

pvp.title: PvP & Safety
pvp.description: Contested Zones are free-fire PvPvE. There's no crimestat inside, and no rules of engagement.
pvp.tip1: Stage your approach. Don't fly straight in — scout the area and parking options.
pvp.tip2: Insurance mindset. If you can't afford to lose it, don't bring it.
pvp.tip3: Even PvE hubs carry risk on approach and departure — Pyro has no law enforcement.

site.title: What This Site Does
site.description: This is a timer tool, not a walkthrough. It helps you track keycard printer cooldowns, vault door cycles, the Executive Hangar schedule, and compboard collection progress.
site.localStorage: All timers are local to your device and browser — nothing is sent to a server. If you clear your browser data, your timers reset.
